title: Channel Nine's The Voice announces new its judges for 2020 after months of speculation
text:
Channel Nine has announced its new line up of judges for the next season of the hit singing show The Voice.

The broadcaster revealed on Wednesday that Boy George, Delta Goodrem, Guy Sebastian and Kelly Rowland would all be returning for the 2020 season.

'Our Coaches are back and ready to find Australia's next Massive Voice,' it captioned the post.

They're back! Channel Nine revealed on Wednesday that Boy George, Delta Goodrem, Guy Sebastian and Kelly Rowland would all be returning for the 2020 season of The Voice

The announcement comes after rumours the foursome had been playing 'hardball' for more pay and even threatened to quit if they weren't handed more cash.

'Channel Nine are keen to have exactly the same coach panel as this year, as they think it is the perfect line-up, especially with Guy being the standout coach with audiences this year,' a source told New Idea.

'Nine wanted to sign them up for next year before this year's series ended. But the feisty coaches are playing hardball.'

No Mr Nice Guy: It comes amid rumours the judges had been playing 'hardball' for more pay and even threatened to quit if they weren't handed more cash

It seems Channel Nine is banking on an all-star line up to fight back against ratings hits such as the Masked Singer.

From the highly-anticipated seventh season of Married At First Sight to the sixteenth season of The Block, there are plenty of shows to keep viewers entertained.

MAFS is set to kick off the year with relationship experts John Aiken, Mel Schilling and Trisha Stratford returning as matchmakers.

There will be 20 brave singles paired from across Australia who are all determined to find their soulmate.

Also airing on Network Nine is Lego Masters, after the show proved to be a smash hit this year with more than 2.3 million viewers tuning in for the final episode.

Australia's best Lego builders will compete against one other to create extraordinary designs using blocks.

Grab the popcorn! Network Nine has revealed the exciting range of popular titles returning to screens in 2020, including The Block

Meanwhile, the wait will be over for The Block fans as the popular renovation show is set to come back.

The show will be moving to the affluent Melbourne bayside suburb of Brighton and applications for potential Blockheads are currently open.

Audiences will also be able to enjoy watching some of Australia's fittest and fastest athletes try to complete the most infamous obstacle course on Ninja Warrior.

In 2020, the phenomenon will return with a new location, new obstacles, a top prize of $400,000 and a knockout challenge for the best competitors.
description: Channel Nine has announced its new line up of judges for the next season of the hit singing show The Voice.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
